TypeSignature.Value: .class nested protected auto ansi beforefieldinit TableRow/CellControlCollection extends System.Web.UI.ControlCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects that are the cells of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> class represents the collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> control. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects can be added at the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> collection with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection.Add%2A> method or at a specified index location in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
Only <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects can be added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a table, add elements to the table programmatically, and then display the table on the Web page. Note how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> control represents a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> collection and how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection.Add%2A> method is used to add cells to the row.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class.
[!code-csharp[TableCell#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/CS/tablecellcs.aspx#5)] [!code-vb[TableCell#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TableCell/VB/tablecellvb.aspx#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.Control child) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds the specified object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The added control can be only a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> object; otherwise, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a table, add elements to the table programmatically, and then display the table on the Web page. Note how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> control represents a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection> collection and how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.CellControlCollection.Add%2A> method is used to add cells to the row.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.Control child);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void AddAt(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.Control child) cil managed

Docs.param: The location in the array to add the child control.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified object to the collection. The new control is added to the array at the specified index location.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The added control can be only a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> object; otherwise, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
